page.title: 14EDUCATION
page.content: Amisfield Primary is a rural,two teacher school situated six miles from Dumfries. The first entry in the original school log book is for October 3, 1864 and reads "The School was re opened after the vacation." Unfortunately, no one seems to know when the school was originally built. At present, the school has thirty pupils in all and has a wide intake area. One child comes from four miles away and, apart from four, all children are transported to and from school by car or mini-bus. As well as two permanent members of teaching staff, we have an itinerant Music and itinerant Art Specialist, both of whom come for sixteen weeks per year. We also have a Teacher for Children with Learning Difficulties for two hours per week. (CONT.)
